title: Mastery and Reflection – Sentence Patterns A–D and Veritas
goals: Review and chant all four sentence patterns (A–D)
Demonstrate understanding of case endings and verb forms
Reflect on the virtue Veritas – Truth in study and speech

steps.speak: Salve! Today is our review and mastery celebration for Week 13.
Let’s recall all four sentence patterns together.
A – Puella amat.  B – Puella rosam amat.  C – Deus est bonus.  D – Dominus servō donum dat.
Excellent! Chant each slowly and translate aloud.
Mini quiz 1 – What case shows who does the action?
Correct – the nominative. Mini quiz 2 – What case shows who receives it directly?
Right – the accusative (-am, -um). Mini quiz 3 – Who receives it indirectly?
Translate together: Puella puerō aquam dat – The girl gives water to the boy.
Faith phrase: Verbum Dei verum est – The Word of God is true. Say it clearly three times.
Virtue reflection – Truth means joining seeing, knowing, and speaking rightly. How does your Latin show truth today?
Well done! You’ve completed Week 13 and mastered A–D sentences. Next week we start new verb families!
